results.name: Least k such that (n+1)^k + n^k is a prime.
comment: Note: k must be of the form 2^m (see A058064 for the m values).

Conjecture: For every pair of relatively prime numbers (x, y) there exist at least one number n=2^m and one prime number p such that p = x^n + y^n. This sequence shows one case of this conjecture where y = x + 1. - _Tomas Xordan_, Jun 02 2007
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(k=1); while (!isprime(p=(n+1)^k + n^k), k++); k; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 16 2018
